Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on September 10, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,

Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:

• (e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
• (i) Directly from the Michigan state
police or the equivalent state law
enforcement agency, Canadian
province, or other country where
the person usually resides or has
resided in the previous 5 years.
Four of seven new hire files reviewed did not have the required references
completed at time of hire.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• BBI coaching calls was provided to the facility for additional training and
changing the staff culture assistance.
• A review of licensing rules with the administration was completed to ensure an
understanding of what is expected and allowed.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• A review the intake packet was completed, and the facility was directed to
change the language from “acknowledgement and consent of physical
restraint” to “acknowledgement of physical restraint” and remove all consent
wording from the packet.
• The Chief Administrator was provided support in accessing CWLM.
• A review and discussion occurred for the facilities hiring process. It was
recommended the facility change the screening, hiring, and onboarding
process to be done locally at the facility instead of from their corporate office in
another state. Chief Administrator recognized and had already begun to make
these changes prior to the recommendation. A hiring tool was provided to the
facility, Abuse Prevention Services.
• Corrective Action Plan formulation and what is required for the plan was
reviewed with Chief Administrator.
• A review of files for education was completed and the facility was provided
consultation on what documentation is needed for school, and the enrollment
of the youth being their burden to have completed within 5 school days.
• A review of what is needed to change the licensee designee was discussed.
• A recommendation to have leadership onsite more frequently on all shifts to
provide coaching and mentoring in real time for staff on floor.

• An addendum was completed for the classroom to be utilized as a bedroom for
the shelter youth if needed due to the challenging population they serve.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has been monitored for six corrective action plans during this period
under review, however no new corrective action plans have been submitted during
the period under review.
• Special Investigation 2024C0000833 with CAP approval date of
12/18/2023 was a result of a violation for not providing outdoor recreation
time, medication errors, and staff interventions. The agency fixed the
outdoor recreation area and provided additional outdoor programming in
the meantime. The agency restrained all medical staff and medication
passing staff on documentation expectations and the medical supervisor
reviews all MAR documentation, followed by the Facility Administrator. The
administration reviewed all rules regarding youth interventions and will not
allow cancellation of visits to be done as a result of youth behaviors. The
agency completed all action steps for this CAP successfully on May 28,
2024.
• Special Investigation 2024C0000923SI with CAP approval date of
1/12/2024 was a result of a violation for Sufficiency of Staff. The agency
removed the staff who did not intervene when needed from the detention
unit and placed them on the shelter unit to work alongside a supervisor for
each shift. In addition, the staff in the incident was written up for their
failure to supervise the youth properly. The administration will do walk-
throughs of each program and provide greater guidance in the milieu
during second shift. All staff were retrained on staff supervision
expectations. The agency completed all action steps for this CAP
successfully on June 29, 2024.
• Special Investigation 2024C0000939SI with CAP approval date of
2/12/2024 was a result of a violation for Staff Qualifications, Incident
Notifications and Reports, and Restraint Reports. The agency retrained
staff on counter aggression during the annual physical restraint training
and during monthly staff meetings. Staff were retrained on incident report
writing during initial training and the annual refresher training, including the
expectation that all staff involved write their own incident report. The
management team was reviewing all incident reports during the daily
meeting and ensuring they are completed in MiSACWIS timely. The
agency completed all action steps for this CAP successfully on July 24,
2024.

• Special Investigation 2024C0000956SI with CAP approval date of
2/12/2024 was a result of a violation for Improper Restraint, and Restraint
Reports. The agency identified the staff that used an improper technique
and provided retraining on the SCM model. The administration of the
agency created more of a presence in the milieu specifically in the evening
hours by doing walk-throughs and working on shift with newer staff. All
staff were retrained on SCM restraints, and incident report writing during
an annual refresher and team meetings. The administration was reviewing
incident reports during the daily management meeting to ensure
compliance. The agency completed all action steps for the CAP
successfully on August 8, 2024.
• Special Investigation 2024SIC0001140 with CAP approval date of 5/9/2024
was a result of a violation for Staff Interventions, Staff Qualifications, and
Incident Reports. The agency provided a refresher training for staff
interventions, restraints, and incident reporting. The administration
completed daily walk-throughs of each milieu and spent time in the milieu
on second shift to mentor new staff and provide supervision and support to
all staff. The administration provided more “in the moment” coaching for
staff development. The agency researched and implemented an emotional
intelligence training and assessment for all staff. Administration is
reviewing camera footage to monitor staff interactions with youth.
Administration presence will be included in all staff interviews. The agency
is currently in compliance with all action steps in this CAP action steps,
and DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
• Special Investigation 2024SIC0001204 with a CAP approval date of
6/3/2024 for not enrolling youth in school as required. The agency changed
their intake process as it relates to school and now has all school
enrollment completed the day of intake or the next business day if on a
weekend or evening. The clinical director and case manager are
responsible for all follow-up communication with the school and to ensure
the youth are enrolled within 5 school days of placement. The facility is
currently in compliance with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to
monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility’s
budget and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief administrator recognized
a reoccurring factor in many investigations over the past year was due to staffing
temperament and maturity of staff to work with challenging youth. Chief
administrator implemented an emotional intelligence training for current employees

and a screening for new employees in order to address this issue. Chief
administrator reported all of the corrective action plans are either completed or
implemented and have increased the compliance with the rules.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported they feel
safe and well cared for at Osceola Youth Center. Youth reported they feel
comfortable talking to staff and reported positive relationships with staff.
Staff members report feeling supported by administration. They reported being
well informed and trained on job expectations. Staff have all reported
administration is present on the floor and easy to get ahold of when needed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on September 10,
2024. There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
